intro: Onobrychis majorovii, commonly known as the Balkan sainfoin, is a perennial legume native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in racemes. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Onobrychis majorovii is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it useful in ecological restoration projects.
